headline: Did Capitol Police Put Wire Tapps In GOP Rep. Troy Nehls's Underpants, Or Is He Just Babbling?
author: Evan Hurst
sentences:
But Nehls really would like to explain what was drawn on that whiteboard:
Nehls explained that the writing on the board — which included reports of faulty Chinese-made body armor — was related to legislation his office was working on, while the map of the Rayburn Building, which Nehls said “looked like it was done by my 9-year-old,” was drawn for an intern who was sent on a mission to find the ice machine.

Nehls vociferously claims the Capitol Police is "maliciously investigating me in an attempt to destroy me and my character," and says this is maybe happening because "I have been a vocal critic of @SpeakerPelosi, the @January6thCmte, and @CapitolPolice leadership about their handling of January 6th, the death of Ashli Babbitt and the subsequent SHAM investigation."

… I find this more than just mere coincidence that pictures are going to be taken of my legislative priorities and shared with intelligence agents who then shared the picture with a supervisor in the intelligence shop.”
OK.
Nehls says he would like his office swept for bugs, please.

The officer filed a report raising concerns about the contents of the whiteboard, which included mentions of “body armor” and a poorly drawn map of the Rayburn House Office Building — which is also part of the Capitol complex — that had an X at one of the building’s entrances.

Capitol Police Chief Thomas Manger says first of all, on the first occasion, Capitol Police went into Nehls's office because Nehls's office was standing wide open and that's what the Capitol Police does when it finds an apparently empty office standing wide open.

Nehls went on to explain that on November 20, 2021, the Capitol Police "entered my office without my knowledge and photographed confidential legislative products protected by the Speech and Debate clause enshrined in the Constitution, Article 1 Section 6."

So the officer goes in because there's an office standing open, then ends up filing a report because there's a whiteboard inside with a map of one of the congressional office buildings and an X marks the spot, plus mentions of "body armor."

AND THEN two days later on Nov. 22, a Monday, three Capitol Police intel officers tried to come in again and found a member of his staff and proceeded to question them about the pictures they ILLEGALLY took two days prior.

Anyway, point is that everything is a witch hunt and this is all A OUTRAGE and Nehls is just really concerned about that dead white terrorist Ashli Babbitt blah blah blah hashtag JerkingOffWithoutLubeDotGif.

The Capitol Police respond WAAAAAAAH we only entered your office because you left the door standing wide open and it's protocol to check things out when that happens, you dumb fucking dildo, WAAAAAAH.
Nehls went on Tucker Carlson yesterday and wailed that Nancy Pelosi is "weaponizing the US Capitol Police to investigate me, to try to silence me, intimidate me, and quite honestly, to destroy me."
He says they indeed followed up that Monday and that was that, and "No case investigation was ever initiated or conducted into the representative or his staff,” according to his statement.
Jim Jordan is going on Newsmax and just asking questions about whether the Capitol Police are spying on a member of Congress and saying we must get to the truth.

Tell us if you've heard this story before:
A Republican congressman gets on Twitter to scream WAAAAAAH THE CAPITOL POLICE INVADED MY OFFICE TO PERSECUTE ME!
Nehls told the Washington Post he's fine with the "rank and file" of the Capitol Police, but he's mad about the picture and the investigation.
You absolutely must read the clownbonkers thread Nehls, a member in good standing on Team Seditionist, posted on Twitter yesterday morning.
The intelligence division of the Capitol Police did an illegal investigation of his office and one of his staffers caught them!
Except that when people run off to bellyache to Tucker Carlson about shit like this, it automatically raises our spidey senses.
“I am very aware of January 6 — I believe it was a law enforcement issue, a law enforcement failure,” Nehls said.
Hey remember when Tucker started babbling last summer about the NSA putting wiretaps in his underpants?
OK. Did they really draw a picture of the whole building to show an intern where the ice machine was?
They did acknowledge that a photo was taken in a letter they sent Nehls at the end of last month.
“I’ve been a critic on that, and I’ve been a very vocal critic on Ashli Babbitt’s death.
(Wouldn't want his enemies to catch wind of his secret ice machine routes, probably.)
Remember how Tucker is literally pushing "1/6 Was An Inside Job" conspiracy theories?

Except for one thing:
Golly, we'd be interested in knowing what that's all about.
If you're not already, would you pls consider being the few thousandth and one?
HE DOES NOT SAY IF THERE WERE ANY OTHER MEMBERS OF THE VILLAGE PEOPLE PRESENT.
Pelosi clarified today that actually she doesn't control the Capitol Police.

Here's some of that Tucker appearance:
So that's what we know about this.
Again, the Capitol Police says no such investigation was initiated.
Republican congressman screams WAAAAAAAAAH I'M TELLING TUCKER!
Wonkette is funded ENTIRELY by a few thousand people like you.
Here's where the details start to get a bit HENNNNGGGGGHHHH?
Were there any other members of the Village People present?
Did he mention they were dressed as construction workers?
But apparently nothing came of it, according to Manger.
Yeah, that's why it raises our spidey senses.
Well, because Troy Nehls is talking about it!
Everything about that is kinda weird, yeah?
THEY WERE DRESSED AS CONSTRUCTION WORKERS.
The Capitol Police says not quite, though.
Seems like a good place to end this post.
Anyway, all of this is totally normal.
OK. Is that in fact what is going on?
But that's what's happening with Rep.
and goes on Tucker, to tell Tucker.
How often would you like to donate?
So this is all batshit, obviously.
So why are we talking about this?
Oh well, guess we'll find out.
Sure, anything is possible!
Sure, anything's possible!

It starts here:
BREAKING!
Nothing more do we know.
So that's melodramatic.
The X marked the spot.
Troy Nehls of Texas.
DRUDGE SIREN!
OPEN THREAD.
That's odd.
said Nehls.
said Nehls.
said Nehls.
